abstract: Gretchen Morgenson Fair Game column says Securities and Exchange Commission filed proceedings against Eagle Investment Management for improperly billing clients; says firm paid out almost $40 million in settlement; points out action against mutual fund may be indication of looming crackdown against dubious fees.
lead_paragraph: First Eagle Investment Management reached an agreement with the S.E.C., and it might just be the start of the commission’s crackdown on fund companies’ hidden fees.

headline.main: S.E.C. Turns Its Eye to Hidden Fees in Mutual Funds
headline.print_headline: Dubious Marketing Fees Catch the Eye of the S.E.C.

snippet: First Eagle Investment Management reached an agreement with the S.E.C., and it might just be the start of the commission’s crackdown on fund companies’ hidden fees.
